title: Secure CI/CD Pipeline
description: Security checklist for a secure CI/CD pipeline, derived from leading industry sources in 2025

categories.description: Ensure robust authentication, granular permissions, and identity safeguards across the pipeline.

items.item: Review and audit permissions for human and machine identities regularly
Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all users accessing the CI/CD pipeline
Monitor and log access attempts, alert on anomalous or unauthorized actions
Avoid the use of shared accounts; enforce unique identities for users/services
Revoke stale, unused, or former employee/service identities promptly
Implement strong access controls and role-based permissions for all CI/CD components

categories.description: Secure code, configuration, and build artifacts with integrity verification and secure workflows.

items.item: Use software composition analysis on open-source dependencies
Employ checksum and digital signatures for build artifacts
Scan IaC, config, and pipeline files for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations
Enforce mandatory approvals for all code changes (flow control)

categories.description: Protect secrets and credentials by centralizing, rotating, and scanning for exposures.

items.item: Audit and monitor secret usage (retrievals/usage logs)
Restrict access to secrets based on least-privilege policies
Store secrets (API keys, tokens, passwords) in an enterprise secrets manager
Scan all code, configs, and images for exposed or hardcoded secrets
Ensure secrets are never stored or transmitted in plaintext
Rotate secrets and credentials regularly as part of standard operations

categories.description: Ensure isolation of environments, secure dependencies, and minimize attack propagation.

items.item: Only use actively maintained and supported open-source libraries
Harden and patch build environments and agents
Prevent code movement between isolated environments except through validated processes
Isolate CI/CD environments (dev, test, staging, prod) using network segmentation and firewall rules

categories.description: Enable comprehensive monitoring, incident response, and protection throughout pipeline operation.

items.item: Create alerting for suspicious or unauthorized activities across pipeline and workload hosts
Document incident response playbooks for CI/CD security events
Enable runtime protection tools (RASP, application monitoring) on deployed services
Integrate automated security scanning (IDS/IPS, vulnerability scanners) into CI/CD workflows

categories.description: Maintain operational continuity with robust patch, backup, and disaster recovery procedures.

items.item: Document and update a disaster recovery plan for pipeline environments
Automate regular backup of CI/CD environments and code repositories
Automate patching of CI/CD tooling and infrastructure
Test and validate backup and recovery procedures periodically
Store backups in secure and geographically separate (offsite/cloud) locations
Conduct regular security audits and remediate discovered issues promptly

categories.description: Ensure all sensitive data in the CI/CD lifecycle is encrypted in transit and at rest, minimize sensitive data exposure.

items.item: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit throughout the pipeline
Restrict access to encryption keys and audit their use
Apply strict encryption key management and rotation policies
Use industry-standard cryptographic algorithms and protocols only
Regularly test data protection controls for effectiveness
Ensure no plaintext credentials or secrets are logged or stored

categories.description: Identify, prioritize, and remediate vulnerabilities in CI/CD tools, code, and dependencies.

items.item: Maintain and monitor a vulnerability disclosure and remediation process
Ensure CI/CD systems and dependencies are patched promptly
Document patch management procedures and review their effectiveness regularly
Track and remediate vulnerabilities in base images and build agents
Prioritize and address critical vulnerabilities before promotion to production
